prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would. How many triangles can be formed using the vertices of a regular dodecagon (a 12-sided polygon)?
solution: No three vertices are collinear, so any combination of 3 vertices will make a triangle. Choosing 3 out of 12 is $\binom{12}{3}=\boxed{220}.$
gpt_response:
To find out how many triangles can be formed using the vertices of a regular dodecagon (12-sided polygon), we can use the formula for finding the number of combinations of choosing 3 vertices out of 12.

The formula for combinations is nCr = n! / r!(n-r)!, where n is the total number of items and r is the number of items being chosen at a time.

In this case, n = 12 (the number of vertices in a regular dodecagon) and r = 3 (we want to choose 3 vertices to form a triangle).

Plugging the values into the formula, we get:

12C3 = 12! / 3!(12-3)!
12C3 = 12! / 3!9!
12C3 = (12 x 11 x 10 x 9!) / (3 x 2 x 1 x 9!)
12C3 = 220

Therefore, there are 220 triangles that can be formed using the vertices of a regular dodecagon.
